result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin Nathan Clausing was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

4:16 PM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: Benoy   Defendant Benjamin Nathan Clausing in court, in custody.  Attorney Timothy Dale Anderson in court.  Attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for State of Wisconsin.  Atty Smestad recites resolution. DE is currently in custody in Chippewa Co.  Release date of 10/4/22.  Victim can not be located.  Court questions warrant for Atty fees. Response by Atty Anderson.  Court QUASHES Warrant.  Payment plan to commence again 11/1/22.  DE pleads G w/out DC enhance. Court reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights.  Court finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Court accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty without DC enhancer. Sentencing arguments. Court orders:      

- Costs of $443 
           payment plan approved $25 per month commencing 11/1/22

records.addlTxt:
Status conference on June 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Settlement conference on July 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Leah Clausing.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
